title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 October 2013 - XWiki
content:
<UCC> has quit  
00:41 <sburjan`> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
07:46 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <vmassol> good morning  
10:05 <sburjan> has quit  
10:06 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <msmeria> brace yourselves... more spam is coming :)  
11:55 <vmassol> mflorea: I almost got you tricked with my comment edition but you caught it ;)  
11:55 <mflorea> yes, np ;)  
11:56 <vmassol> ouch  
11:56 <vmassol> just build XE from sources  
11:56 <vmassol> and it doesn't start  
11:56 <vmassol> Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: javax.validation.ParameterNameProvider  
11:57 <vmassol> someone changed something yesterday?  
11:57 <mflorea> I have a snapshot from yesterday morning, so yes, it must be very recent change  
11:59 <mflorea> has quit  
11:59 <vmassol> note that I've just built enterprise  
12:00 <vmassol> (dep artifacts have been downloaded from nexus)  
12:00 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
12:01 <msmeria> has quit  
12:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:10 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:51 <vmassol> mflorea/tmortagne: on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=XWiki.InstalledExtensions it says Panels UI 5.1 and 5.2 are both installed, any idea why? :)  
13:51 <vmassol> (same for some other extensions)  
13:52 <mflorea> vmassol: Show Details -> "Installed on the following namespaces: Playground"  
13:52 <mflorea> you're on the main wiki, so you see the extensions installed everywhere  
13:52 <vmassol> ah  
13:52 <vmassol> didn't know the main wiki was doing that  
13:53 <vmassol> something to improve  
13:53 <vmassol> because it looks strange to see 5.1 and then 5.2 is installed :)  
13:53 <vmassol> maybe we could improve the display somehow  
13:54 <vmassol> also should I do something about "installed but not valid" for http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?section=XWiki.InstalledExtensions&search=wiki+manager&repo=installed?  
13:55 <vmassol> wiki manager ui 5.2 requires wiki manager api 5.2 but it says 5.1 is installed but not vali  
13:55 <vmassol> \*valid  
13:56 <mflorea> I don't see any "installed but not valid message"  
13:57 <vmassol> mflorea: I see this: https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/9ef02def-4086-40cb-bce5-3ad18f48d873/e351e802ae3b4319e2b66d4bb90e352e  
14:00 <ldubost> has quit  
14:01 <mflorea> I see it too now. Well, Wiki Manager API 5.1 was installed as a dependency of Wiki Manager Application 5.1. Now Wiki Manager API 5.2 is a core dependency, bundled with XE, so the upgrade of Wiki Manager Application 5.2 left Wiki Manager API 5.1 unused. You should uninstall it.  
14:01 <vmassol> so I should uninstall 5.1 and reinstall 5.2?  
14:01 <vmassol> (for wiki manager api)  
14:02 <mflorea> no, just uninstall Wiki Manager API 5.1. You cannot install/uninstall 5.2 version because it is a core extension. You cannot touch it.  
14:02 <vmassol> ah yes indeed  
14:03 <mflorea> The general case is this: you install a jar, which in the next verison of XE becomes a core extension, i.e. we bundle it with XE  
14:03 <mflorea> the previous version becomes invalid, and should be uninstalled  
14:03 <vmassol> yep got it  
14:03 <vmassol> not sure all users will get it but I understand  
14:03 <mflorea> indeed..  
14:07 <tmortagne> vmassol: yep wikimanager api is invalid here because a core extension already exist  
14:10 <tmortagne> note that it's just an information (it's not loaded since it's invalid)  
14:16 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
14:17 <vmassol> has quit  
14:37 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:41 <Slashman> has quit  
14:45 <vmassol1> just rebuilt XE from sources again and I still get https://gist.github.com/vmassol/7040991 when I use it  
14:45 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
14:45 <vmassol> am I the only one?  
14:45 <vmassol> there doesn't seem to be a problem on ci  
14:46 <vmassol> removing my local repo and rebuilidng enterprise  
14:46 <tmortagne> this class is supposed to come from validation-api-1.1.0.Final.jar  
14:47 <tmortagne> (javax.validation.ParameterNameProvider)  
14:47 <tmortagne> and this is a dependency of xwiki-properties  
14:47 <tmortagne> xwiki-commons-properties  
14:49 <tmortagne> we don't force it in the commons root pom so maybe you have a conflict between several dependencies and end up with the wrong version  
14:53 <vmassol> ok it works now  
14:53 <vmassol> after removing my local repo and rebuilding xe  
14:54 <tmortagne> anyway we should maybe put it in the root pom like other standard libraries to be extra safe  
14:55 <Slash\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:55 <Slashman\_> has quit  
14:56 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:57 <mflorea> has quit  
14:57 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:59 <vmassol> Denis: hi, do you agree that http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XEM-208 can be solved by the signed script proposal?  
15:00 <Denis> vmassol: not sure to get the point  
15:00 <vmassol> he wants to be able to use PR on his wubwiki AFAIU  
15:00 <vmassol> \*subwiki  
15:00 <vmassol> BTW what's the jira issue for signed scripts?  
15:01 <Slash\_\_> has quit  
15:01 <Denis> see the roadmap  
15:01 <vmassol> ok you updated it cool  
15:01 <Denis> I will update further, trying to create sub tasks  
15:01 <vmassol> hmm I don't like subtasks  
15:02 <vmassol> I'd perfer several top level tasks  
15:02 <vmassol> as otherwise you'll not be able to close the top level one and it'll be empty with no commits  
15:02 <Denis> yep, I means cut the problem in independant pieces  
15:02 <vmassol> ok  
15:02 <vmassol> good  
15:03 <Denis> just have taken the one thomas d created and make public for now  
15:03 <vmassol> yep seen the public part  
15:03 <Denis> but, I see it as a too big new feature to hold everythings  
15:03 <vmassol> yes probably  
15:04 <Denis> moreover, I have reviewed the code from Thomas, and I am really unhappy of the implementation  
15:05 <Denis> I still do no understand what XEM-208 means  
15:07 <vmassol> Denis: nm, I've closed it, we'll see if he replies  
15:10 <Slashman\_> has quit  
15:13 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:27 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:36 <Slashman> has quit  
15:38 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:40 <Slashman\_> has quit  
15:40 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:48 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
16:01 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:13 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
16:21 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
17:07 <GuillaumeF> Hello. Could anybody remind me how to pass a real list of strings, from a page to another within the request?  
17:08 <tmortagne> you mean what is the syntax in a URL ?  
17:08 <GuillaumeF> If I send a true list within the queryString, it can only be received as a string on the other page. A string that look like a list ([...,...,...])  
17:08 <GuillaumeF> I don't really know.. ways to do that  
17:08 <GuillaumeF> I'm validating a page with a form, I'd like to send a list I generated ealier in the page  
17:08 <GuillaumeF> but no way to make it work  
17:09 <tmortagne> if you want to pass a list of things in a URL you do it the following way: http://toto?list=element1&list=element2  
17:09 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
17:10 <GuillaumeF> hmm.. but that works only if I use html blocks of the same "name", right? Because at the moment, I have a XWiki list, so... could I strip it to send it?  
17:10 <GuillaumeF> I know I did what you're suggesting before, with a table with several fields. But now, I'm trying to put send it via a "hidden" type field  
17:11 <vmassol> GuillaumeF: see also http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SavingData  
17:11 <GuillaumeF> because the data I want to send is not related to the form, but the page itself  
17:11 <GuillaumeF> ok thanks!  
17:11 <vmassol> actually we need to update this page with request, xcontext  
17:12 <tmortagne> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SavingData won't help as far as I can see  
17:12 <vmassol> ah xcontext is mentioned  
17:12 <tmortagne> GuillaumeF does not want to save a list  
17:12 <vmassol> only thing missing is passing data in the URL  
17:14 <GuillaumeF> or maybe adding some objects to the context and retrieving it from the next page? (total newbie in xwiki context)  
17:14 <tmortagne> GuillaumeF: so you don't want to generate a query string but you want to use a hidden html form input ?  
17:15 <GuillaumeF> I'm open to all ideas :D queryString would be ok, that's what I tried, but I failed because the list I send, is retrieved as a string on the other page.  
17:15 <tmortagne> the same way you repeat the field in the URL you can repeat the input element in the html  
17:15 <tmortagne> as in:  
17:15 <tmortagne> <input type="hidden" name="myHidden" value="1"> <input type="hidden" name="myHidden" value="2"> <input type="hidden" name="myHidden" value="3">  
17:16 <tmortagne> I can't answer for you  
17:16 <tmortagne> I need to know your situation  
17:16 <GuillaumeF> so you suggest I put a input in a foreach? that would work, indeed  
17:16 <tmortagne> are you in a form ?  
17:16 <GuillaumeF> yep  
17:16 <tmortagne> so then yes generate the input elements in a foreach  
17:16 <tmortagne> it's probably the easiest  
17:16 <GuillaumeF> great, haven't even thought about it  
17:17 <GuillaumeF> thank you  
17:17 <GuillaumeF> (ftr, target is glimpse wiki, so internal needs)  
17:21 <vmassol> evalica: ping  
17:21 <vmassol> why are you removing labels?  
17:21 <vmassol> for example: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8729  
17:22 <tmortagne> evalica: same here, those labels are important informations  
17:23 <evalica> well since now we are gonna use labels for roadmap items - I was trying to clean them somehow and remove labels that are single, duplicate the title or description  
17:23 <tmortagne> using a defined list of labels to filter some issues does not imply you have to remove all the other labels...  
17:25 <vmassol> exactly  
17:25 <vmassol> we're loosing data here  
17:25 <mflorea> has quit  
17:26 <tmortagne> labels are tags and I'm -1 to have a hard defined list of valid labels, anyone should be able to put any labels he want to categorize issues  
17:26 <evalica> well if the information is already somehow in the title or description and is not a 'common' label with what it helps you to search/refine the data?  
17:27 <tmortagne> again I'm -1 to say there is a defined list of valid labels  
17:27 <vmassol> same  
17:28 <vmassol> it's not something we should conrol  
17:28 <vmassol> \*control  
17:28 <tmortagne> searching for jython related issue using the label is important, the fact that there is only one right now does not make it invalid label  
17:28 <evalica> except XWIKI-8729 is any other issue you thing it should have it's label back?  
17:28 <vmassol> I haven't checked all you removed  
17:28 <tmortagne> evalica: it's impossible that we ever have another issue about jython ?  
17:29 <vmassol> next time might be better to ask :)  
17:29 <vmassol> it's a lot of work for you to put back all labels you removed  
17:29 <tmortagne> and again I don't care there is only one issue at a given time for which the label make sense  
17:30 <evalica> no there is not - since I didn't removed much, but I won't put them back, because some were not supposed to be there  
17:30 <tmortagne> there is no such thing as invalid labels except a label that does not have anything to do with the issue  
17:30 <evalica> I consider it to be cleanup work somehow  
17:30 <tmortagne> ...  
17:30 <vmassol> you sure cleaned up :)  
17:30 <vmassol> but too much  
17:32 <sburjan> has quit  
17:33 <evalica> has quit  
18:08 <tmortagne> has quit
